channel.title: DevTube the place where developer videos live
channel.description: DevTube the place where developer videos live

item.title: Live Stream #146: Recamán's Sequence + ml5 Image Classifier
item.description:
Exploring Recamán's Sequence in p5.js + starting to explore the ml5.js library.
35:37 - Recamán's Sequence 1:27:05 - Sound Experiments with Recamán's Sequence 2:28:25 - ml5 Image Classifier
🔗 Recamán's Sequence on MathWorld: http://mathworld.wolfram.com/RecamansSequence.html 🔗 TensorFlow.js: https://js.tensorflow.org/ 🔗 ml5.js: https://ml5js.org 🔗 Nature of Code: https://natureofcode.com/ 🔗 OEIS: http://oeis.org/ 🔗 Bernardo Recamán Santos on Wikipedia: https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernardo_Recam%C3%A1n_Santos 🔗 ml5 on Adjacent: https://itp.nyu.edu/adjacent/issue-3/ml5-friendly-open-source-machine-learning-library-for-the-web/ 🔗 MobileNets: Efficient Convolutional Neural Networks for Mobile Vision Applications: https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.04861
🎥 Recamán's Sequence by Numberphile: https://youtu.be/FGC5TdIiT9U 🎥 TensorFlow.js Color Classifier: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRqwX-V7Uu6bmMRCIoTi72aNWHo7epX4L 🎥 TensorFlow.js playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRqwX-V7Uu6YIeVA3dNxbR9PYj4wV31oQ 🎥 pcomp on Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/channels/pcomp 🎥 ADSR Envelope with p5.js: https://youtu.be/wUSva_BnedA 🎥 Sound Synthesis with p5.js: https://youtu.be/Bk8rLzzSink
🚂 Website: http://thecodingtrain.com/ 💖 Patreon: https://patreon.com/codingtrain 🛒 Store: https://codingtrain.storenvy.com 📚 Book recommendations: https://www.amazon.com/shop/thecodingtrain
💻 https://github.com/CodingTrain/website
🎥 For an Introduction to Programming: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8j0UDiN7my4&index=1&list=PLRqwX-V7Uu6Zy51Q-x9tMWIv9cueOFTFA 🎥 To watch archived Live Streams: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRqwX-V7Uu6bxnFR6no70vlxxuxDEzflz 🎥 For more Coding Challenges: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRqwX-V7Uu6ZiZxtDDRCi6uhfTH4FilpH
🔗 https://p5js.org/ 🔗 https://processing.org

item.title: Obsessive-Compulsive Development: Retro/Grade Postmortem
item.description:
In this 2013 GDC session, 24 Caret Games' Matt Gilgenbach talks about the development of Retro/Grade and his new and healthier approach to indie game development.
Register for GDC: http://ubm.io/2gk5KTU
Join the GDC mailing list: http://www.gdconf.com/subscribe
Follow GDC on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Official_GDC
GDC talks cover a range of developmental topics including game design, programming, audio, visual arts, business management, production, online games, and much more. We post a fresh GDC video every day. Subscribe to the channel to stay on top of regular updates, and check out GDC Vault for thousands of more in-depth talks from our archives.

item.title: @keyframers 1.0.0 | Flipping Fluent | Live streamed collaborative animation coding
item.description:
The @keyframers (http://twitter.com/keyframers) premier, where David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw live code an animation. This week's episode: Flipping Fluent, we work with transitioning state smoothly utilizing Flipping ( https://github.com/davidkpiano/flipping )
Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/keyframers
Shownotes: * Animation Inspiration: https://dribbble.com/shots/3511459-Fluent-Design-Email-app-Loading * Flipping https://github.com/davidkpiano/flipping * Final code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/jzePyB * Animation at Work Slack: http://slack.animationatwork.com
Skip around! 2:10 Animation reveal 4:40 Start coding 1:41:50 Overview 2:02:10 Animation at Work Shoutout

item.title: Oceanic Overlays | CSS-only carousel | @keyframers 1.7.0 | Collaborative coding live stream
item.description:
This week, David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw save the oceans using only CSS! Follow along as they toggle, slide and clip to create an inspiring page design. Streamed live on May 24, 2018.
Shownotes:
* Animation Inspiration: https://dribbble.com/shots/4592180-Save-The-Oceans-Website * Final code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/RyzaYY/
Skip around: 2:20 Showcase 6:35 Animation overview 10:38 Start coding 49:00 Puns 1:41:00 Keyflections
Additional Resources:
* CSS Mask animation https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/NMeXoN * Encroachment (CSS-only) https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/OZGMKq/ * Overriding Default Button Styles https://css-tricks.com/overriding-default-button-styles/ * CSS-only Colorful Calendar Concept https://codepen.io/davidkpiano/pen/xwyVXO
Like what we're doing? There are many ways you can support @keyframers so we can keep live coding awesome animations!

item.title: Top 10 Reasons to Learn Cybersecurity | Why Cybersecurity is Important | Edureka
item.description:
** Cybersecurity Online Training: https://www.edureka.co/cybersecurity-certification-training ** This Edureka video talks about the Top 10 Reasons to Learn Cybersecurity and what makes the Cybersecurity a lucrative career choice. Watch it now!!
Cybersecurity Training Playlist: https://bit.ly/2NqcTQV
Subscribe to our channel to get video updates. Hit the subscribe button above.
-------------------------------------------
About Edureka Cyber Security Training
Cybersecurity is the combination of processes, practices, and technologies designed to protect networks, computers, programs, data and information from attack, damage or unauthorized access.
Edureka’s Cybersecurity Certification Course will help you in learning about the basic concepts of Cybersecurity along with the methodologies that must be practiced ensuring information security of an organization. Starting from the Ground level Security Essentials, this course will lead you through Cryptography, Computer Networks & Security, Application Security, Data & Endpoint Security, idAM (Identity & Access Management), Cloud Security, Cyber-Attacks and various security practices for businesses.
------------------------------------------------
Why Learn Cyber Security?
Cybersecurity is the gathering of advances that procedures and practices expected to ensure systems, PCs, projects and information from assault, harm or unapproved get to. In a processing setting, security incorporates both cybersecurity and physical security, it is imperative since cyberattackers can without much of a stretch take and obliterate the profoundly grouped data of governments, defense offices and banks for which the results are huge so it is essential to have an appropriate innovation which an avoid digital wrongdoings.
---------------------------------------------------
Objectives of Edureka Cyber Security Course
This course is designed to cover a holistic & a wide variety of foundational topics of the cybersecurity domain which will be helpful to lead freshers as well as IT professional having 1 to 2 years of experience, into the next level of choice such as ethical hacking/ audit & compliance / GRC/ Security Architecture and so on This course focuses mainly on the basics concepts of Cyber Security In this course, we are going to deal with Ground level security essentials cryptography, computer networks & security, application security, data & endpoint security, idAM (identity & access management), cloud security, cyber-attacks and various security practices for businesses This course will be your first step towards learning Cyber Security --------------------------------------
Who Should go for this Training?
Anyone having the zeal to learn innovative technologies can take up this course. Especially, students and professionals aspiring to make a career in the Cybersecurity technology. However, Cybersecurity Certification Course is best suited for the below mentioned profiles:- Networking Professionals Linux Administrators -----------------------------------------------
Please write back to us at sales@edureka.co or Call us at US: +18336900808 (Toll Free) or India: +918861301699
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/edurekaIN/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/edurekain LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/edureka

item.title: Movable Mountains | @keyframers 1.12.0 | Parallax scroll animation live collaborative coding
item.description:
David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw do an early stream recreating a beautiful parallax scroll effect using primarily CSS with a few JS augmentations.
(Audio is a bit quieter than usual with more ambient noise, but it's still an action packed stream. Enjoy!)
⏰ Streamed live on June 21, 2018. 📺 Video: https://youtu.be/vatBdNK-OiQ 💡 Inspiration: https://dribbble.com/shots/4726786-Discovery-Tours-Parallax-Header-Scroll 💻 Code: https://cdpn.io/pen/PaRJWm/
Skip around: 0:30 Animation overview 4:00 Start coding 44:20 Keyflections
Like what we're doing? There are many ways you can support @keyframers so we can keep live coding awesome animations!
* Like & Subscribe on YouTube * Follow & Tweet us at twitter.com/keyframers. * Join the live streams & Subscribe on Twitch http://twitch.tv/keyframers * Support us on Patreon at https://patreon.com/keyframers
Topics covered:
* CSS-only Parallax * CSS Variables * Animated Cropping with scale

item.title: CSS-only loading animations LIGHTNING ROUND| @keyframers 1.9.0
item.description:
The video isn't buffering, we're just building loaders! David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw tackle a variety of different loader animations using only CSS. Some are spectacular, some are... spectacular failures. All of them will surely delight! Streamed live on June 7, 2018.
Final Code Collection: https://codepen.io/collection/nevLNZ/
Impatient Loader by Steve G 02:00 https://codepen.io/steveg3003/details/pKNjZE/
1.9.0 | Evitare loader 05:10 Animation: https://dribbble.com/shots/4268258-Evitare-loader Code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/yEVJaY
1.9.1 | Clock Loader 48:10 Animation: https://dribbble.com/shots/4434643-Clock-Loader-Interaction Code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/GGNNgW
1.9.2 | Simple Loading - Boxes 01:08:50 Animation: https://dribbble.com/shots/4358464-Simple-Loading-Boxes Code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/vryyZm
1.9.3 | Solar Eclipse 01:21:13 Animation: https://dribbble.com/shots/1982200-Solar-Eclipse Code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/WyoozY
1.9.4 | Loading spinner 01:39:35 Animation: https://dribbble.com/shots/4645074-Loading-spinner Code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/Wyoomm
Like what we're doing? There are many ways you can support @keyframers so we can keep live coding awesome animations!
* Like & Subscribe on YouTube * Follow & Tweet us at twitter.com/keyframers. * Join the live streams & Subscribe on Twitch http://twitch.tv/keyframers * Support us on Patreon at https://patreon.com/keyframers

item.title: CSS-only Calendar Conundrum | @keyframers 1.11.0 | Collaborative Coding Live Stream
item.description:
Challenge Accepted!
David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw rise to the challenge raised on Twitter, recreating an amazing, if not improbable calender UI interaction using CSS only. Will they succeed or fail? Watch to find out!
Streamed live on June 18, 2018.
Shownotes: * Twitter Threads: https://twitter.com/jevakallio/status/934805883552501766 https://twitter.com/swyx/status/1008739405069209603 * Animation Inspiration: https://dribbble.com/shots/2189703-calendar-motion * Final code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/pKpwWN/

item.title: Antonio Leiva - Yo Dawg! I heard you like Kotlin (DevFest Baltics)
item.description:
Kotlin is the new official language to develop Android Apps, and it can be used almost everywhere. But did you know you could write a complete App without using other language rather than Kotlin? It can substitute Java in your code, XML in your views and Groovy in your Gradle files.
More information about awesome conference: https://devfest.gdg.lv

item.title: Krzysztof Zabłocki - Metaprogramming in Swift (DevFest Baltics)
item.description:
Lets take a look at recently released Sourcery and how it can be applied in variety of different use-cases to make development more powerful and enjoyable, while at the same time limiting amount of human mistakes.
More information about awesome conference: https://devfest.gdg.lv

item.title: @keyframers 1.2.0 | Reactive Animations with RxJS talk for CodePen Houston by David Khourshid
item.description:
This week's @keyframers episode featured David Khourshid giving a short talk and live coding demonstration at CodePen Houston on Reactive Animations with RxJS followed by a Q&A.
Sponsored by ELL Creative ( http://ellcreative.com ), a creative marketing and advertising agency in Houston, TX.
Final CodePen: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/pVvmJo/
Show Notes: * David Khourshid http://twitter.com/davidkpiano * @keyframers http://twitch.tv/keyframers * CodePen Demo: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/pVvmJo/ * RxJS http://reactivex.io/rxjs * React Animated https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/animated.html

item.description:
This week, David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw put the mouse to the metal as they recreate one of the most challenging animations yet, streamed live on May 17, 2018.
Can you beat 70 MPPS? Post in the comments!

item.title: @keyframers 1.1.0 | Sliced Slides | Live streamed collaborative animation coding
item.description:
David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw live code this week's animation: Sliced Slides. We'll be using the sliding layers technique and a microlibrary called SplittingImage (https://github.com/shshaw/SplittingImage).
Apologies for the stream quality this week. There were some technical issues we're working through that will hopefully be resolved for next week. Audio quality remains great throughout fortunately!
Shownotes: * Animation Inspiration: https://dribbble.com/shots/4122652-Gallery-Page-Transition * SplittingImage: https://github.com/shshaw/SplittingImage * Final code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/EEqxWV
Skip around: 2:34 Animation overview 5:40 Start coding 36:00 SplittingImage 1:32:43 Overview

item.title: Soccer Scroller! Live coding a scrolling text effect in RxJS | @keyframers 1.10.0
item.description:
(Apologies for the audio issue at the beginning, we resolve it around 1:15)
GOOOOOOOOOOOAL! David Khourshid and Stephen Shaw put on their shin guards & lace up their cleats to recreate some animations from the beautiful soccerpattern.com
Shownotes:
* Animation Inspiration: http://soccerpattern.com * Final code: https://codepen.io/shshaw/pen/dKzLxJ/
Skip around: 2:15 Q&A 7:20 Animation overview 9:28 Start coding 1:46:20 Keyflections 2:00:00 Accessibility
Additional Resources:
* RxJS https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs * Animated Intro to RxJS https://css-tricks.com/animated-intro-rxjs/ * Reactive Animations with RxJs talk by David Khourshid at CodePen Houston https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H7FEK6geguM * Understanding the Almighty Reducer https://css-tricks.com/understanding-the-almighty-reducer * Animation Tip: LERP https://codepen.io/rachsmith/post/animation-tip-lerp * SVG Encoded for background-image https://codepen.io/shshaw/full/rrOZQQ * Probably Don't Base64 SVG https://css-tricks.com/probably-dont-base64-svg/ * Introduction to Reduced Motion Media Query https://css-tricks.com/introduction-reduced-motion-media-query/
Like what we're doing? There are many ways you can support @keyframers so we can keep live coding awesome animations!
